## Overview

- Dataset: World Development Indicators (2022)
- Focus: **distribution** (GDP per capita, life expectancy) and **ranking** (inflation)
- Methods: Python (pandas, matplotlib) rendered with Quarto [@quarto_docs]
- Source attribution: WDI [@worldbank_wdi]

---

## Data Setup

::: {#06de98da .cell execution_count=1}

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Rows: 217, Columns: 14
```
:::
:::


## GDP per Capita — Distribution

::: {#e86ae82e .cell execution_count=2}

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display}
![Distribution of GDP per capita across countries (2022).](slides_files/figure-revealjs/cell-3-output-1.png){width=661 height=374}
:::
:::


Notes: 
Right-skewed distribution with a long upper tail.

## Life Expectancy — Distribution

::: {#283ae585 .cell execution_count=3}

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display}
![Distribution of life expectancy across countries (2022).](slides_files/figure-revealjs/cell-4-output-1.png){width=662 height=374}
:::
:::


Notes: 
Most countries cluster around the low-to-mid 70s.

## Inflation — Ranking (Top 15 by Population)

::: {#d4c71d9c .cell execution_count=4}

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display}
![Inflation rate (annual %, 2022) — 15 most populous countries.](slides_files/figure-revealjs/cell-5-output-1.png){width=662 height=374}
:::
:::


Notes.
Wide spread across major economies.


## Key Takeaways

- GDP per capita: highly right-skewed distribution (few very high-income countries).

- Life expectancy: tighter spread around ~70–75 years.

- Inflation: substantial variation among the most populous economies.

## Reference

- Data: World Bank WDI [@worldbank_wdi]

- Built with Quarto (Reveal.js) [@quarto_docs]
